May 15, 1977: Fiction
OLIVER'S STORY, by Erich Segal. (Harper & Row, $7.95.) Tearless but well-
meaning sequel to "Love Story."
FALCONER, by John Cheever. (Knopf, $7.95.) Stunning prison novel of escape
and redemption.
TRINITY, by Leon Uris. (Doubleday, $10.95.) One family's meander through a
century of modern Irish history.
THE CRASH OF '79, by Paul E. Erdman. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) Sheiks, oil,
International intrigue and skullduggery.
HOW TO SAVE YOUR OWN LIFE, by Erica Jong. (Holt, Rinehart & Watson,
$8.95.) Isadora again.
THE CHANCELLOR MANUSCRIPT, by Robert Ludlum. (Dial, $10.) Topical
thriller.
CONDOMINIUM, by John D. MacDonald. (J.B. Lippincott, $10.) Disaster hits
Leisure Village.
A BOOK OF COMMON PRAYER, by Joan Didion. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) A
woman adrift...
THE VALHALLA EXCHANGE, by Harry Patterson. (Stein & Day, $8.95.) More
Nazis pitted against heroic Allied stereotypes.
EAST WIND, RAIN, by N. Richard Nash. (Atheneum, $9.95.) Pearl Harbor on the
eve.
Non-Fiction
YOUR ERRONEOUS ZONES, by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer. (Funk & Wagnalls, $6.95.)
Breezy self-help pep talk.
PASSAGES, by Gail Sheehy. (Dutton, $9.95.) Help for adults undergoing
developmental crises.
ROOTS, by Alex Haley. (Doubleday, $12.50.) One man's family and an important
document of Black History.
HAYWIRE, by Brooke Hayward. (Knopf, $10.) Moving memoirs of a Hollywood
childhood.
CHANGING, by Liv Ullmann. (Knopf, $8.95.) The film star on life, Bergman and,
sketchily, her art.
THE GAMESMAN, by Michael Maccoby. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) Innovative
study of the new corporate man, to whom winning is the only thing.
THE GRASS IS ALWAYS GREENER OVER THE SEPTIC TANK, by Erma
Bombeck. (McGraw-Hill, $6.95.) Suburban humor by the columnist.
EVERYTHING YOU'VE ALWAYS WANTED TO KNOW ABOUT ENERGY BUT
WERE TOO WEAK TO ASK, by Naura Hayden. (Hawthorne, $5.95.) Get your
vitamins.
MAJESTY, by Robert Lacey. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $12.50.) The Queen
Elizabeth II story.
THE DAVID KOPAY STORY, by David Kopay and Perry Deane Young. (Arbor
House, $8.95.) Football player on his homosexuality.
